...The point here is that the thief enters the lab after working hours because "NO ONE ELSE IS AROUND", so no one can see him stealing data.

The use of a swipe-card to access the lab can prevent this in two ways: if the thief is someone who shouldn't be authorized to enter the lab he won't get the card and it will be much more difficult for him to access the lab (first he should steal a card from someone who has it); if the thief is a person who is authorized to access the lab he would get his card BUT he would also know that, even if he enters when no one else is around, his access to the lab would be logged and, after a while, it would be easy to find out who is stealing data; at least he would have to justify why he accessed the lab after working hours.

Just knowing that there is a greater risk of getting identified, the thief would be discouraged, so the swipe card is both a deterrent and a preventive measure.
